style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: Little Machine Beer
breweries.description: New brewery, founded by industry veterans, in the Jefferson Park neighborhood of Denver.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

data.description:
Where would we be without our home state? Celebrating 165 years of statehood, La Florida officially joined the union in 1845. Hence the name for our All-American Pilsner.

Light in color and balanced in taste, the 1845 deserves it’s own flag. According to the history books, the Governor of Florida signed our statehood papers on the steps of the Capitol. We’re gonna bet the assembled group celebrated with a special kind of Florida beer, if only 1845 had been available on tap!

The smooth, crisp taste is as American as baseball and apple pie, with a little something special just from Florida thrown in. We might not have a lone star or a tv show about a yankee shoreline, but we do have our own brand of Florida pride. And y’all, we can drink ours.
data.foodPairings: Chicken Kiev; Braised Ribs; Grilled Flounder; Peppery cheeses like Monterey and Pepper Jack

breweries.name: Pensacola Bay Brewery
breweries.description:
Once upon a time, two guys who had never met, had a glass of beer.
Who knew that years later, their love of beer would bring them together.

Elliott Eckland and Mark Robertson started this journey in 2009, and in October 2010 opened the doors of the Pensacola Bay Brewery. Focusing on local Pensacola landmarks and lore, the Pensacola Bay Brewery mixes a little Florida history in each pint.

data.name: 1st Anniversary
data.description: Our first year anniversary Imperial Pilsner is an unfiltered, hopped-up lager brewed with true German malt. Hallertau hops, added twice in the fermenter, give this special brew plenty of flavor and aroma while maintaining a drinkable presence. Available on draft and in 22-ounce bottles while supplies last.

breweries.description:
Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's newest microbrewery.

Proudly located in the seaside city of Westerly, Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's premier microbrewery equipped to produce up to 4,000 barrels of handcrafted beer per year.

breweries.name: 7 Seas Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Formed in 2008 by Travis Guterson and Mike Runion, 7 Seas Brewing is an innovative craft brewery, making audacious, yet technically well-executed beers; utilizing cans rather than bottles; and championing environmental stewardship.

Having survived a fire at our original location which delayed our opening by six months, we now occupy a 3,000 square foot brewing facility superbly located in Gig Harbor, Washington.

At 7 Seas Brewing we strive to brew, innovate and perfect the Ultimate Proper Pint, one that will invoke an emotional, contemplative response from the drinker. It should cause them to smile, knowing that in our homogenized, cookie cutter world of consumerism, there are still people crafting something of integrity and authenticity.

data.name: 3 Golden Hairs
data.description: The Three Golden Hairs is a clean crisp and refreshing Czech style pilsner. This beer is brewed with German Pilsen malt and hopped with Saaz hops, giving it a clean crisp malt backing accentuated by the floral hop aromas and flavors of the hops. A perfect beer to bring in the spring!

breweries.name: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse
breweries.description: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse is a craft brewery in Loveland, Colorado! They feature German style beers and other unique flavors. Grimm Brothers Brewhouse is devoted to the art and science of beer and brewing. A passion for brewing and sharing of exciting flavors of beer are at the heart of this brewery’s values. Grimm Brothers Brewhouse was founded by avid home brewers and beer enthusiasts who love producing quality, flavorful beers.

breweries.name: Breckenridge Brewery
breweries.description: Breckenridge Brewery was founded in 1990 in Breckenridge, Colorado. In the past two plus decades Breckenridge Brewery has grown from a small 3,000-barrels-a-year brewpub to one of the most successful craft beer and restaurant companies in the nation. It now handcrafts more than 70,000 barrels of fresh beer annually and owns and operates five brewpubs and ale houses in the state of Colorado. For more information visit www.breckbrew.com.

locations.name: The Ale House at Amato's,  Denver

data.name: 6e Soir
data.description: This beer was specially brewed for Dieu du Ciel’s sixth anniversary. It reflects the tendency of American brewers to push all beer styles to the extremes. This lager is therefore quite strong in alcohol and it has a sharp but delicate bitterness, like all pilsners. The beer is full-bodied and well balanced thanks to the delicate sweet flavours that come through.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

data.name: 7 Cities Pilsner
data.description:
Seven Cities Pilsner, an unfiltered German Pilsner is the first lager style beer to be released by Jackalope Brewing Company.
 It is brewed entirely with noble German Tettnang hops and pours a beautiful light golden color,
 thus we named it after the myth of the Seven Cities of Gold.
 It is a light bodied, refreshing brew with hints of Pilsen malt sweetness,
 and a smooth yet hoppy finish.

data.description: Light, crisp and dry, this pilsner was made with Weyermann floor malted pilsner malt. Slightly malty, it has an assertive hop flavor and bitterness. Our lightest colored beer to date.

breweries.name: Amherst Brewing Company
breweries.description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

data.name: Admiral Lublin's Imperial Pilsner
data.description: With a rank befitting its strength, Admiral Lublin’s Imperial Pilsner stands frothy heads above its contemporaries. We outfitted our brewship with 100% Polish hops (Lublin, Junga and Sybilla). Splashed upon a brilliant, golden backdrop of Pilsen malt, these spicy, fruity hops impart a flavor profile similar to German noble hops but with a little extra character, Na zdrowie!

breweries.name: Snowy Mountain Brewery
breweries.description:
The Snowy Mountain Brewery is located in beautiful Saratoga, Wyoming and is the anchor brewpub for the Saratoga Resort and Spa.  The Saratoga Resort and Spa consistently draws people from all over Colorado and Wyoming due to its unique offering of a variety of amenities in one location--such as an on-site brewery, mineral hot spring pools, great food, western-styled rooms, jeep, ATV and snowmobile rentals, a golf course and a full-service spa.  

The Snowy Mountain Brewery is gaining in exposure and was featured recently in Travel Pulse’s “5 Unique Beer Vacation Spots in the U.S.!”  The name Snowy Mountain is fitting for the brewery as it sits adjacent the majestic Snowy Range Mountains, in southern Wyoming. Boasting 8-10 different craft beers throughout each season, the Snowy Mountain Brewery is one of the fastest growing breweries in Wyoming and surrounding states. The famous brewpub, with a throw-back to the wild west, is adorned with big game mounts and bar-stools made with six-shooters and patinated saddles and features a full pub menu with selections that compliment Saratoga's finest craft beers.

data.description: Our old Rüthener Hell has a spicy-sour character, with its golden yellow color and its alcohol content of 4.8% beer Pilsener style.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

data.name: American Pilsner
data.description: 2-row brewers malt, roasted barley with Liberty hops from Washington and the prized East Kent Goldings’ aroma hop from England make a refreshing beer.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener

breweries.name: Von Jakob Brewery
breweries.description:
As Von Jakob Vineyard, we have brought exceptional wines to the Southern Illinois area and beyond for over 15 years. Now, we are excited to introduce Von Jakob Brewery, complete with hand-crafted brews, made exclusively at our Orchard location in Alto Pass, Illinois.

Offering eight styles of beer ranging from our crisp, clean, lightly-hopped American Pilsner to our rich, dark Stout, you are sure to find a beer that delights your palate. Or, if you are having trouble choosing just one, we offer a flight of all eight delicious beers. We also have a great selection of domestic beers as well as premium beers from around the world for your enjoyment.

And for our wine enthusiasts out there, do not worry – our winery isn’t going anywhere. We just thought we would offer you a different libation of choice, should you want to explore it.

We sincerely thank you for your support over the years, and we welcome you to come and experience this next adventure with us!

data.name: American Pilsner
data.description: Our take on a German style Pilsner.  We take your traditional German Pils and add a good old American Hop Punch.  This beer is clean, crisp and refreshing.  This golden lager is the perfect beer for hot Virginia summer days.

Enjoy corn hole, big screen TVs and live music. Dog/kid friendly.

data.name: American Pilsner

data.name: Amstel 1870 Pilsner
data.description:
Years later, we paid homage to Amstel Brewery’s founding date with Amstel 1870. Its delicious taste is a monument to the timeless spirit of the city.

A true bitter beer
Slightly darker in color
Fine aromatic hops and a specific blend of barley malts
*You’ll only find this bier on your travels outside the U.S.

breweries.name: Amstel Brewery
breweries.description: The brewery was founded on June 11, 1870 in Amsterdam and named after the Amstel River, the waters of which also served for refrigeration. By 1872, Amstel was annually producing 10,000 hectoliters. For the purpose of storing the beer, winter ice from canals was kept in special double-walled cellars. Originally, the beer was mostly drank in Amsterdam. From 1883, it was also exported to Great Britain and Indonesia.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: The Bruery
breweries.description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

breweries.description: Our little family started at the Witch's Hat in South Lyon in 2007 when we said "I do". When life dealt us lemons we decided to make beer. Here we are - trying our hand at the Beer Lover's Dream. Give us a taste :)

breweries.name: Brenner Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Brenner Brewing Co. is a microbrewery in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Founder, Mike Brenner was awarded the title Master Brewer after completing a rigorous international training program at the Siebel Institute and the Doemens Akademie. Every aspect of the brewery includes the founders lifelong commitment to supporting local art and music.

Brenner's passion for crafting delicious beer and his lifelong devotion to Milwaukee's arts and music scene, has led to the creation of Brenner Brewing's "12 Ounce Ambassadors." Each style of beer features the artwork of a local artist and comes with a soundtrack featuring the music of local bands. As Brenner Brewing's distribution expands so does the awareness of Milwaukee's incredible arts scene.

Brenner also opened a 25,000 sq ft arts incubator in the building with the brewery which features a 2,000 sq ft contemporary art gallery and 20 artists' studio spaces. Come visit the brewery, tasting room, and art gallery soon.

data.name: Bagdad Ale
data.description: Bagdad Ale is a benchmark beer for McMenamins. Inspired by the Pilsner style, our Bagdad Ale is one for the lager lovers. Its fine hop aroma and quick, light finish makes this a good ale for hot weather. It has become a favorite at McMenamins Bagdad Theater in Portland.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. breweries.name: McMenamins Breweries
breweries.description:
Since our first brew at the Hillsdale Brewery & Public House in 1985, McMenamins has produced more than 57,600 batches. In 2011 our breweries collectively crafted 3302 batches of beer (including over 250 new and unusual house-specific recipes) more than 47,263 kegs of beer or an astounding 5.8 million pints!

In keeping with McMenamins' company philosophy, our breweries believe that brewing "green" is brewing responsibly.

Many beer lovers are familiar with our ales, such as Terminator Stout, Hammerhead, Ruby, Edgefield Wheat, Black Rabbit Porter, Sunflower IPA and others. Read more about these "standards" and dozens of others, including our beloved seasonal ales.

Due to the nature of handcrafting, it's safe to say that no two McMenamins batches are identical. Science and technology provide the backbone for our craft, but it is the unique qualities of each brew house, and the individual brewer's ale-crafting style, that ensure you will enjoy liquid refreshments that are truly special and made with every care for the environment. Cheers!

breweries.name: Oskar Blues Brewery
breweries.description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

Established in 2007, Belmar, New Jersey based Beach Haus Brewery was founded by passionate individuals with a belief that the great American traditions of creativity, diversity, and accessibility apply equally to building a great beer company.

breweries.name: Fordham & Dominion Brewing Company
breweries.description: Based on our shared values and a common philosophy of quality brewing, Fordham & Dominion joined forces in 2007 and consolidated operations in 2009. The First State is now home to the Fordham & Dominion Brewing Co., where beer lovers from near and far are able to stop by, get to know us, and enjoy our handcrafted beer and soda. Our roots run deep throughout the Mid-Atlantic region and we remain dedicated to our craft.

breweries.name: Beck's Brewery
breweries.description:
Beck's Brewery (Brauerei Beck & Co) is a brewery in the north German city of Bremen. Owned by local families until February 2002, it was then sold to Interbrew  for 1.8 billion euros. The brewery was formed under the name Kaiserbrauerei Beck & May o.H.G. on 27 June 1873, by Lüder Rutenberg (8 February 1816 ? 14 June 1890), Heinrich Beck, and Thomas May. On 1 October 1875, Thomas May left the brewery which then became known as Kaiserbrauerei Beck & Co.

Beck's ranks number 5 among Germany's best selling breweries.

locations.name: Miami Yacht Club
locations.extendedAddress: 1001 MacArthur Cswy Miami, FL  33132 United States

data.name: Bela
data.description: Bela may sound like a sweet name, but she's actually quite bitter.  A beer style that does not technically exist, the addition of over 25 pounds of Czech Saaz hops in this small-batch beer results in high hop bitterness and quite obvious Noble hop aroma and flavor. It is also a high alcohol beer with a nice warming effect, medium-body and some malty residual sweetness to remind you that Bela might still have a sweet side after all.

breweries.name: DESTIHL Brewery
breweries.description: DESTIHL opened its first gastrobrewpub (DESTIHL Restaurant & Brew Works) in Normal, IL in November 2007 and added its second gastrobrewpub in downtown Champaign in April 2011, where the company focuses on both artisan food and beers.  DESTIHL’s 20,000sf production brewery project in Bloomington, IL commenced in September 2012 with brewing starting in May 2013 and includes a 25-barrel brewhouse, several large fermenters and 100,000 cubic feet of barrel-aging space. It has taken countless hours to develop the unique concept that is now DESTIHL, where the brewery team utilizes both global brewing traditions and new American craft brewing ingenuity and artisanship to make uncommon beers uncommonly well.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: Railway City Brewing Company
breweries.description: Railway City Brewing Company is a small micro brewery located in the heart of downtown St.Thomas. We brew many different styles of beer including our Dead Elephant Ale, Iron Spike and monthly Seasonal offerings.

data.name: Bellheimer Lord Pils
data.description:
Brewed with crystal-clear, natural water from our own deep well. 700 years ago It rained off without negative environmental effects and was particularly powerful by strata pure and germ-free filtered.

These come from best malt Palatinate Spring barley and hops aroma true to the German Purity Law of 1516.

data.name: Bibo
data.description: Bibo® (pronounced bēbō) is a true pilsner with ingredients from five different countries that has a pronounced continental hop flavor and aroma in an incredibly well-balanced package. We use an enormous amount of the classic Czech Saaz and a touch of Motueka hops from New Zealand to put a new world twist on this beautiful old world style. Motueka offers a subtle pineapple note that underlies a harmony of the traditional black pepper, herbal, and cracker grain character pilsners are famous for. Bibo® is dry, quenching, and frankly amazingly delicious.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Creature Comforts Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Creature Comforts was founded by people passionate for starting a craft brewery in Athens, GA, a town that we love and that has the potential to be a craft beer hub and destination for the South East.  The first piece of the puzzle was David Stein who at the time was the head brewer at Twain's Billiards & Tap, a well-known brewpub in Decatur, GA.   David was a home brewer turned pro, whose passion for craft beer had moved him through working at some of the top craft beer establishments.  David was using the name Creature Comforts for his personal home brews and that name became the foundation for the brewery we run today.  David quickly brought on his friend Adam Beauchamp, who was in his seventh year of brewing beer at Sweetwater Brewing Company in Atlanta, GA, a brewery he began working at after leaving a PHD in Genetics program at Emory.  Adam himself was an accomplished home-brewer and he had a wealth of experience running a production brewery.                   

With the help of a craft beer enthusiast and local Athens, GA businessman, Derek Imes, we began building Creature Comforts in a beautiful 13,000 square foot historic warehouse building in downtown Athens.  The building was originally built in the 1940's as a Chevy dealership and later became Snow Tire Co., before Creature Comforts took over.  Building in a 1940's warehouse presented a lot of challenges as well as many wonderful opportunities.  One such opportunity was the chance to salvage and reclaim the old wood from the building that was subsequently refinished and then put back into the brewery in the form of bar tops, tables, wall paneling, and ceilings.  The final result, is a brewery that has won an award for outstanding rehabilitation by the Athens Heritage Foundation and something that we are extremely proud to share with the world.

Approximately two months before opening, we found the final missing piece.  We knew we wanted to bring someone into the family who would handle the business aspects of the brewery, considering the fact that Adam and David are brewers dedicated to spending every minute of their day making the best possible beer.  Through a long journey that ended with a very serendipitous introduction that came via a person in Vancouver, British Columbia, Chris Herron, a Georgia native himself who was living in Connecticut, became the CEO of Creature Comforts.  Chris had spent 12 years working in sales, pricing, and finance for major beverage alcohol suppliers, and was intent on starting a craft brewery in Georgia, which made him joining Creature Comforts an easy choice.   We have since added, Blake Tyers a veteran and forward thinking home brewer as a brewer at Creature Comforts, and we brought on Katie Beauchamp to manage our office activities, tours and special events.  Combined with the nearly 20 part time tour staff we have, our entire family is together and we have  20+ years of experience.

What started out as curious exploration of what we love, turned into us uncovering our passion, following that passion, and finding happiness, which has allowed us to enjoy the Creature Comforts of life.   Creature Comforts Brewing Company is truly our very own creature comfort.  Our brewery is what makes us happy, it is what makes us feel at home, it is what comforts us, and puts us in a happy place.  Creature Comforts is the end result of the story of our past and the starting point for the story our future, and we look forward to writing that story with you.
